title: Bridi-tail Connectives: gi'e
goal: Learn `gi'e` to connect predicates with different arguments.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

je review:

The dog is big and beautiful → ?
Alice is tall and happy → ?

(Answers: lo gerku cu barda je melbi, la .alis. cu clani je gleki)

New Material (5-7 min)

New Vocabulary

Lojban Place Structure English
simsa x1 is similar to x2 in property x3 similar
mintu x1 is the same as x2 in property x3 same/identical

When to Use gi'e vs je

Use When
je Same arguments for both predicates
gi'e Different arguments (places)

Using gi'e (And)

mi klama la .paris. gi'e cadzu la .london.

I go to Paris and walk in London.

mi citka lo plise gi'e pinxe lo djacu

I eat apples and drink water.

The shared sumti (mi) applies to both predicates, but each has its own objects.

The gi'e Family

Cmavo Meaning
gi'e and
gi'a or
gi'o iff
gi'u whether or not

Comparison

mi klama je cadzu      → I go-and-walk (same place?)
mi klama gi'e cadzu    → I go and I walk (separate events)

Key Point

gi'e connects bridi-tails — predicates that share the first sumti but have their own places.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Use gi'e

Translate:

  1. I eat apples and drink water.
  2. Alice goes to Paris and works in London.
  3. I read books and write poems.
Answers
  1. mi citka lo plise gi'e pinxe lo djacu
  2. la .alis. cu klama la .paris. gi'e gunka bu'u la .london.
  3. mi tcidu lo cukta gi'e ciska lo pemci

Exercise 2: je vs gi'e

Choose je or gi'e:

  1. The dog is big and fast. (same subject, same type)
  2. I go to Paris and stay in London. (different places)
  3. Alice is beautiful and tall. (same subject, same type)
Answers
  1. je — lo gerku cu barda je sutra
  2. gi'e — mi klama la .paris. gi'e stali la .london.
  3. je — la .alis. cu melbi je clani

Exercise 3: New Vocabulary

Translate:

  1. Alice is similar to Bob.
  2. This is the same as that.
  3. The dogs are similar.
Answers
  1. la .alis. cu simsa la .bob.
  2. ti mintu ta
  3. lo gerku cu simsa

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I work and rest." → mi gunka gi'e surla
  2. "Alice is similar to Bob." → la .alis. cu simsa la .bob.
  3. "I eat and drink." → mi citka gi'e pinxe

Today's Vocab

Lojban English
simsa similar
mintu same/identical

Grammar:

Cmavo Function
gi'e and (bridi-tail) — connects predicates with shared first sumti
gi'a or (bridi-tail)

Summary

You learned gi'e for connecting predicates that share the first sumti but have different places. Use je for shared places, gi'e for different places.
